standard_metadata.standard_description: Explain why a fraction a/b is equivalent to a fraction (n × a)/(n × b) by using visual fraction models, with attention to how the number and size of the parts differ even though the two fractions themselves are the same size. Use this principle to recognize and generate equivalent fractions.

question.content: **Complete the equation.**   *Hint: Think about how we can fill in each rectangle below to help us find an equivalent fraction.*  $\dfrac34=\dfrac{y}{8}$  ${y}=$

images.alt: rectangle with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded. Same-sized rectangle with 8 equal parts

hints.content: Equivalent fractions have the same area shaded.    How many $\maroonD{\text{eighths}}$ should we shade to cover the same area as $\blueD{\dfrac34}$?
Let's slide the shaded parts together to make them easier to compare.    $\blueD{\dfrac34}=\maroonD{\dfrac68}$

images.alt: rectangle with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded. same-sized rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded, covering the same area as the first rectangle.

question.content: **Which picture has an area equivalent to $\dfrac{3}{4}$ shaded?**

images.alt: rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded.
rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded.
rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded.

hints.content: Let's compare each picture to $\dfrac{3}{4}$. We can slide the shaded parts together to make them easier to compare.

images.alt: rectangle with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded. same-sized rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, covering less area than the first rectangle.
rectangle with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded. same-sized rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, covering less area than the first rectangle.
rectangle with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded. Same-sized rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded, covering the same area as the first rectangle.
rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded.

question.content: **Which picture has an area equivalent to $\dfrac{8}{12}$ shaded?**

images.alt: rectangle with 3 of 4 parts shaded
rectangle with 2 of 3 parts shaded
rectangle with 3 of 6 parts shaded

hints.content: Let's compare each picture to $\dfrac{8}{12}$. We can slide the shaded parts together to make them easier to compare.

images.alt: rectangle with 8 of 12 equal parts shaded. same-sized rectangle with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded, covering more area than the first rectangle.
rectangle with 8 of 12 equal parts shaded. same-sized rectangle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, covering less area than the first rectangle.
rectangle with 8 of 12 equal parts shaded. Same-sized rectangle with 2 of 3 equal parts shaded, covering the same area as the first rectangle.
rectangle with 2 of 3 parts shaded

question.content: **Which picture has an area equivalent to $\dfrac{4}{8}$ shaded?**

images.alt: circle with 3 of 8 parts shaded

circle with 4 of 6 parts shaded
circle with 4 of 8 equal parts shaded. same-sized circle with 4 of 6 equal parts shaded, covering more area than the first circle

circle with 4 of 8 equal parts shaded. same-sized circle with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, covering the same area as the first circle
circle with 3 of 6 parts shaded

question.content: **Which picture has an area equivalent to $\dfrac{1}{3}$ shaded?**

images.alt: circle with 2 of 3 parts shaded
